title.text: Translating a Fragment of Natural Deduction System for Natural Language into Modern Type Theory

entities.text: Translating a Fragment of Natural Deduction System

abstractContent.text: In this paper, we investigate the possibility of translating a fragment of natural deduction system (NDS) for natural language semantics into modern type theory (MTT), originally suggested by Luo (2014).
Our main goal will be to examine and translate the basic rules of NDS (namely, metarules , structural rules, identity rules, noun rules and rules for intersective and subsective adjectives) to MTT.
Additionally, we will also consider some of their general features.

introductionContent.text: In this paper, we will examine two proof-theoretic approaches to natural language semantics.
Specifically, we will explore the possibility of embedding natural deduction systems (NDS, Francez 2015) into modern type theory (MTT, Chatzikyriakidis and Luo 2017b), originally hinted at by.

Our main goal will be to examine and try to translate the basic rules of NDS (namely, meta-rules, structural rules, identity rules, noun rules and rules for intersective and subsective adjectives) to MTT.
Additionally, we will also consider some of their general features.
